question: This scheme is being implemented by the National Safai Karamcharis Finance & Development Corporation (NSKFDC). It aims to provide loans for projects costing up to Rs.75000/ with subsidized interest rates to Safai Karamchari and Scavenger women and their dependant daughters for small and petty business projects. The name of the scheme is _?
explanation: Under the Mahila Adhikarita Yojana (MAY) loan is provided through State Channelizing Agencies (SCAs), Regional Rural Banks (RRBs) and Nationalized Bank to the target group. Loan under this scheme is provided to Safai Karamchari and Scavenger women and their dependant daughters for projects with a maximum project cost up to Rs.75000/- for small and petty trade/business and sundry income generating activities. Loan component from NSKFDC can be provided up to a maximum of 90% of the unit cost and the remaining 10% is to be provided by the State Channelizing Agencies in the form of loan, subsidy or from any other available sources of funds.
